userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Horace Davis Papers (SC0028). Stanford University Archives, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Horace Davis was a United States representative from California, a member of the original Board of Trustees of Stanford University (1885-1916), and President of the University of California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers include family correspondence (with a few pertaining to the Civil War United States Sanitary Commission); correspondence relating to the administration of Stanford University; and a few articles by Davis, diplomas, and pamphlets. The bulk of the papers concern Stanford University, its Board of Trustees, and the problems it faced such as salaries, tuition and fees, faculty reirements, discipline, the 1906 arthquake, and problems of organizing the Board of Trustees. Correspondents include Thomas R. Bard, George Crothers, Henry T. Gage, David Starr Jordan, Samuel F. Leib, George C. Perkins, James D. Phelan, Whitelaw Reid, Eugene E. Schmitz, Silas W. Terry, Booker T. Washington, Benjamin Ide Wheeler and John D. Works.

did.unittitle: 83 ALS and TLS to Davis from: L.B. Farnum; F.W. Vaughan; Alex McDonald; William A. Everett; Eliza Davis (letters are signed E.D. or Mother); George Bancroft; Alex S. Taylor; Alice Dow; John G. [Dawes]; John Charles Bancroft Davis; N.A.M.; Andrew Davis; H.L. [Breed]; Edward Blunt(?); Frederica G. Davis; James Otis; George N. Minot; Hasbrouck; William R. Wadsworth; John Currey (on same letter, signatures of Tom Sweet, M.C. Blanke, Saml. Cowler, H.J. Tilden and L.J. Henry); Horatio R. Storer; and J.W. Austin. (Filed in the order named).
17 ALS from Horace Davis to Lavinia M. Davis, Eliza Davis and John Charles Bancroft Davis.
4 Visitors' Tickets to: Merchants Exchange and News Room; Chicago Board of Trade; Union Merchants' Exchange; and Golden Gate Flouring Mill.

"Old Times," manuscript by Davis read to the Chit-Chat Club,
2. ALS to Davis from Your brother Andrew,
3. Calif. State and County License for selling goods: granted to Davis,
4. Letter to General Conference of the Unitarian Church. (Davis was on the Committee of Conference
5. Diploma from Harvard University - Bachelor of Arts Degree. Received by Davis,
6. Album with sketches and photographs of Davis early homes.
7. Passport for Davis, signed by James G. Blaine, Dept. of State.
8. Two Standard Diaries containing notes, checks, and clippings and personal mementoes,
9. Album containing clippings and letters re Davis' election as President of the State University; also, invitations and letters concerning the inaugeration.
10. Two ledgers containing misc. information (facts, notes and figures).
11. Ledger of expenses for various companies and organizations.
12. Ledger of Inventory of Property [San Francisco].
13. Music book belonging to Davis - contains sheet music and the words.
14. Album containing various clippins re Stanford (particularly the Goebel case, the rioting of 1908 and the Jordan administration).
15. Articles by Davis in The Overland Monthly: Collegiate Education of Women, The Loss of the Harriet, and The Nicaragua Canal,
16. Articles by Davis in The Atlantic Monthly: Shakespeare and Copyright, and in Poet-Lore: Shakespeare and Lyly,
1. California Breadstuffs -- reprinted from the Journal of Political Economy, #2.
2. Christianity in Japan -- reprinted from the Unitarian Review.
3. The Flouring Industry of California -- reprinted from The Overland Monthly,
4. Mrs. Lucretia (Chandler) Bancroft: A letter to her daughter, Mrs. Gheradi. With intro duction by Horace Davis,
6. [Not by Davis] The Union Society of the Civil War with its constitution, etc. and a list of members, Davis included
Manuscript, Is Christianity Applicable to Everyday Life?
The controversy over William C. Hinckley's will,
Last Will and Testament of William C. Hinckley
By-Laws of the Board of Trustess of the Wm. and Alice Hinckley Fund
